newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.05 down at 40.12 to the dollar in the kerb market on Sunday and is likely to fall further, dealers said.
They attributed the fall to fears of tough conditions the International Monetary Fund may impose on Pakistan for economic reforms before releasing a stalled tranche from a standby loan.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on September 10, was 36.9700/37.1549 rupees to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed unchanged at 8.20 percent. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
